001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.StringReader;
005import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
006import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
007import java.net.URI;
008import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
009import java.util.ArrayList;
010import java.util.Arrays;
011import java.util.Comparator;
012import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
013import java.util.LinkedHashSet;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.Map;
016import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
017import java.util.Objects;
018import java.util.Optional;
019import java.util.Properties;
020import java.util.Set;
021import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
022import java.util.function.Function;
023import java.util.function.Supplier;
024import java.util.regex.Matcher;
025import java.util.regex.Pattern;
026
027import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
028
029import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.MutableLogProperties;
030import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyFunction;
031import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter;
032import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter.ChildPropertyGetter;
033import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter.RequiredPropertyGetter;
034import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.PropertyGetter.RootPropertyGetter;
035import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.RequiredResult;
036import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties.Result;
037import io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation.LogConfigurable;
038
039/**
040 * Provides String based properties like {@link System#getProperty(String)} for default
041 * configuration of logging levels and output. Since Rainbowgum is configuration agnostic
042 * LogProperties is a simple string key and string value interface to allow almost any
043 * configuration implementation. The only required method to implement is
044 * {@link #valueOrNull(String)} and thus LogProperties is a functional like interface but
045 * using {@link LogProperties#builder()} is preferred so that a
046 * {@linkplain #description(String) description} can be added.
047 * <p>
048 * If a custom {@link LogProperties} is not configured the default RainbowGum uses System
049 * properties.
050 * <p>
051 * The builtin properties to configure RainbowGum are modeled after <a href=
052 * "https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/docs/3.1.0/reference/html/features.html#features.logging">
053 * Spring Boot logging </a>
054 * <p>
055 * LogProperties should generally be accessed with the {@link PropertyGetter} and
056 * {@link Property} like-monads which will allow safe <em>programmatic</em> data
057 * conversion of the flat key values and useful error messages to users if the property
058 * cannot be mapped or is missing. For more <em>declaritive</em> injection of properties
059 * see {@link LogConfigurable} which will generate builders that can use LogProperties.
060 * <p>
061 * Rainbowgum treates {@value #SEP} in the keys as special separator analogous to
062 * Javascript/JSON and various other configuration systems. Furthermore to work with a
063 * wide set of configuration systems once a property key has a value it is
064 * <strong>RECOMMENDED</strong> that there should not be other property key value with a
065 * key that is a prefix of the previously mentioned key. For example allowing two
066 * properties <code>logging.example=stuff</code>, <code>logging.example.a=A</code> is not
067 * recommended as <code>logging.example</code> is defined as a leaf. The exception to this
068 * rule is logging levels mapped to logger names for consistency with Spring Boot.
069 * <p>
070 * A convention used through out Rainbowgum is to have the property names as constants as
071 * it makes documentation easier. These constants name are suffixed with
072 * <code>_PROPERTY</code> or <code>_PREFIX</code> the former being a fully qualified key
073 * that maybe parameterized and the latter being a partial key ending with
074 * "<code>.</code>". The fully qualified keys are like leaves on a tree.
075 * <p>
076 * Property keys can be paramertized by using
077 * {@link LogProperties#interpolateKey(String, Map)} and a general pattern is
078 * <code>logging.component.{name}.prop</code> where {@value #NAME} is a parameter. Many
079 * property constants use this to allow multiple configuration of components by name.
080 *
081 * <table class="table">
082 * <caption><strong>Builtin Property Patterns</strong></caption>
083 * <tr>
084 * <th>Property Pattern</th>
085 * <th>Description</th>
086 * </tr>
087 * <tr>
088 * <td>{@value #LEVEL_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = LEVEL</td>
089 * <td>Sets the level for the logger. If logger name is missing then it is considered the
090 * root logger. {@link Level#INFO} is the default level for the root logger.</td>
091 * </tr>
092 * <tr>
093 * <td>{@value #CHANGE_PREFIX} + {@value #SEP} + logger = boolean</td>
094 * <td>Allows runtime changing of levels for the logger. By design RainbowGum does not
095 * allow loggers to change levels once initialized. This configuration will allow the
096 * level to be changed for the logger and its children and by default is false as the
097 * builtin {@link LogProperties} is generally static (system properties).</td>
098 * </tr>
099 * <tr>
100 * <td>{@value #ROUTES_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
101 * <td>A comma separated list of routes that should be enabled. If not set
102 * {@value LogRouter.Router#DEFAULT_ROUTER_NAME } is the default.</td>
103 * </tr>
104 * <tr>
105 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
106 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders associated with the route. If not set
107 * {@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} is ued.</td>
108 * </tr>
109 * <tr>
110 * <td>{@value #ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY} = <code>URI</code></td>
111 * <td>Looks up a publisher by URI scheme using the {@link LogPublisherRegistry}. The
112 * publisher is then configured by properties with {@value #PUBLISHER_PREFIX}.</td>
113 * </tr>
114 * <tr>
115 * <td>{@value #APPENDERS_PROPERTY} = <code>List&lt;String&gt;</code></td>
116 * <td>A comma separated list of appenders that should be enabled. If not set
117 * {@value LogAppender#CONSOLE_APPENDER_NAME} is the default.</td>
118 * </tr>
119 * <tr>
120 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
121 * <td>Looks up an output by URI scheme using the {@link LogOutputRegistry}. The output is
122 * then configured by properties with {@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX}.</td>
123 * </tr>
124 * <tr>
125 * <td>{@value #APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY } = <code>URI</code></td>
126 * <td>Looks up an encoder by URI scheme using the {@link LogEncoderRegistry}. The encoder
127 * is then configured by properties with {@value #ENCODER_PREFIX}.</td>
128 * </tr>
129 * <tr>
130 * <tr>
131 * <td>{@value #OUTPUT_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
132 * <td>Configures the named output. The name of the output usually comes from the
133 * appender.</td>
134 * </tr>
135 * <tr>
136 * <td>{@value #ENCODER_PREFIX} + <code>propertyName</code></td>
137 * <td>Configures the named encoder. The name of the encoder usually comes from the
138 * appender.</td>
139 * </tr>
140 * <tr>
141 * <td>{@value #FILE_PROPERTY} = URI</td>
142 * <td>A URI or file path to log to a file. This is for Spring Boot compatibility.</td>
143 * </tr>
144 * </table>
145 *
146 * @see LogConfigurable
147 */
148public interface LogProperties {
149
150        /**
151         * properties separator.
152         */
153        static final String SEP = ".";
154
155        /**
156         * Logging properties prefix.
157         */
158        static final String ROOT_PREFIX = "logging" + SEP;
159
160        /**
161         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
162         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
163         */
164        static final String LEVEL_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "level";
165
166        /**
167         * Logging change properties prefix.
168         */
169        static final String GLOBAL_CHANGE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "global.change";
170
171        /**
172         * Logging change properties prefix.
173         */
174        static final String CHANGE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "change";
175
176        /**
177         * Logging file property for default single file appending. The value should be a URI.
178         */
179        static final String FILE_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "file.name";
180
181        /**
182         * A common key parameter is called name.
183         */
184        static final String NAME = "name";
185
186        /**
187         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
188         */
189        static final String OUTPUT_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "output.{" + NAME + "}.";
190
191        /**
192         * Logging output prefix for configuration.
193         */
194        static final String ENCODER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "encoder.{" + NAME + "}.";
195
196        /**
197         * Enabled Logging appenders. The value should be a list of names. This is equivalent
198         * to {@value #ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY} with name "default".
199         */
200        static final String APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "appenders";
201
202        /**
203         * Logging appender prefix for configuration.
204         */
205        static final String APPENDER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "appender.{" + NAME + "}.";
206
207        /**
208         * Output appender property.
209         */
210        static final String APPENDER_OUTPUT_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "output";
211
212        /**
213         * Encoder appender property.
214         */
215        static final String APPENDER_ENCODER_PROPERTY = LogProperties.APPENDER_PREFIX + "encoder";
216
217        /**
218         * Logging publisher prefix for configuration.
219         */
220        static final String PUBLISHER_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "publisher.{" + NAME + "}.";
221
222        /**
223         * Routes enabled with names comma separated.
224         */
225        static final String ROUTES_PROPERTY = ROOT_PREFIX + "routes";
226
227        /**
228         * Route prefix for configuration.
229         */
230        static final String ROUTE_PREFIX = ROOT_PREFIX + "route.{" + NAME + "}.";
231
232        /**
233         * Logging publisher URI property.
234         */
235        static final String ROUTE_PUBLISHER_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "publisher";
236
237        /**
238         * Appenders associated with a route comma separated.
239         */
240        static final String ROUTE_APPENDERS_PROPERTY = ROUTE_PREFIX + "appenders";
241
242        /**
243         * Logging level properties prefix. The value should be the name of a
244         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level level}.
245         */
246        static final String ROUTE_LEVEL_PREFIX = ROUTE_PREFIX + "level";
247
248        /**
249         * Analogous to {@link System#getProperty(String)}.
250         * @param key property name.
251         * @return property value.
252         */
253        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key);
254
255        /**
256         * Gets a list or null if the key is missing and by default uses
257         * {@link #parseList(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
258         * as a list using {@link LogProperties#parseList(String)} but custom implementations
259         * may rely on their own parsing or the data type is builtin to the backing
260         * configuration system.
261         * @param key property name.
262         * @return list or <code>null</code>.
263         * @apiNote the reason empty list is not returned for missing key is that it creates
264         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
265         */
266        default @Nullable List<String> listOrNull(String key) {
267                String s = valueOrNull(key);
268                if (s == null) {
269                        return null;
270                }
271                return parseList(s);
272        }
273
274        /**
275         * Gets a map or null if the key is missing and by default uses
276         * {@link #parseMap(String)}. The default implementation will parse the string value
277         * as map using {@link LogProperties#parseMap(String)} but custom implementations may
278         * rely on their own parsing or the data type is builtin to the backing configuration
279         * system.
280         * @param key property name.
281         * @return map or <code>null</code>.
282         * @apiNote the reason empty map is not returned for missing key is that it creates
283         * ambiguity so null is returned when key is missing.
284         */
285        default @Nullable Map<String, String> mapOrNull(String key) {
286                String s = valueOrNull(key);
287                if (s == null) {
288                        return null;
289                }
290                return parseMap(s);
291        }
292
293        /**
294         * Searches up a {@value #SEP} separated path using this properties to check for
295         * values.
296         * @param root prefix.
297         * @param key should start with prefix.
298         * @return closest value.
299         * @see #searchPath(String, Function)
300         */
301        default @Nullable String search(String root, String key) {
302                return searchPath(key, k -> valueOrNull(concatKey(root, k)));
303
304        }
305
306        /**
307         * Describes a key and by default is usually just the key.
308         * @param key key.
309         * @return usually the key.
310         */
311        default String description(String key) {
312                return key;
313        }
314
315        /**
316         * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A higher
317         * number gives higher precedence.
318         * @return zero by default.
319         */
320        default int order() {
321                return 0;
322        }
323
324        /**
325         * Abstract log properties builder.
326         *
327         * @param <T> builder.
328         * @apiNote this abstract class can largely be ignored hence why it is sealed.
329         */
330        public sealed abstract class AbstractBuilder<T> {
331
332                protected @Nullable String description = null;
333
334                protected int order = 0;
335
336                protected Function<String, String> renameKey = s -> s;
337
338                protected List<LogProperties> fallbacks = new ArrayList<>();
339
340                /**
341                 * Ignored.
342                 */
343                protected AbstractBuilder() {
344                }
345
346                /**
347                 * Add a fallback properties.
348                 * @param properties fallback not null.
349                 * @return this.
350                 */
351                public T from(LogProperties properties) {
352                        this.fallbacks.add(properties);
353                        return self();
354                }
355
356                /**
357                 * For returning this.
358                 * @return this builder.
359                 */
360                protected abstract T self();
361
362                /**
363                 * Description for properties.
364                 * @param description not null.
365                 * @return this.
366                 */
367                public T description(String description) {
368                        this.description = description;
369                        return self();
370                }
371
372                /**
373                 * When log properties are coalesced this method is used to resolve order. A
374                 * higher number gives higher precedence.
375                 * @param order order.
376                 * @return this.
377                 */
378                public T order(int order) {
379                        this.order = order;
380                        return self();
381                }
382
383                /**
384                 * Renames the key before it accesses function.
385                 * @param renameKey rename key function.
386                 * @return this.
387                 */
388                public T renameKey(Function<String, String> renameKey) {
389                        this.renameKey = renameKey;
390                        return self();
391                }
392
393                enum Format {
394
395                        PROPERTIES() {
396                                @Override
397                                Map<String, String> toMap(String content) {
398                                        var m = new LinkedHashMap<String, String>();
399                                        StringReader reader = new StringReader(content);
400                                        try {
401                                                PropertiesParser.readProperties(reader, m::put);
402                                        }
403                                        catch (IOException e) {
404                                                throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
405                                        }
406                                        return m;
407                                }
408                        },
409                        URI_QUERY() {
410                                @Override
411                                Map<String, String> toMap(String content) {
412                                        return parseMap(content);
413                                }
414                        };
415
416                        abstract Map<String, String> toMap(String content);
417
418                        Function<String, String> parse(String content) {
419                                return toMap(content)::get;
420                        }
421
422                }
423
424        }
425
426        /**
427         * Builder for properties.
428         */
429        public final static class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
430
431                private Function<String, String> function;
432
433                private Builder() {
434                }
435
436                @Override
437                protected Builder self() {
438                        return this;
439                }
440
441                /**
442                 * Sets what is called on {@link LogProperties#valueOrNull(String)}.
443                 * @param function valueOrNull func.
444                 * @return this.
445                 */
446                public Builder function(Function<String, String> function) {
447                        this.function = function;
448                        return this;
449                }
450
451                /**
452                 * Parses a string as {@link Properties}.
453                 * @param properties properties as a string.
454                 * @return this.
455                 */
456                public Builder fromProperties(String properties) {
457                        function = Format.PROPERTIES.parse(properties);
458                        if (description == null) {
459                                description = "Properties String";
460                        }
461                        return this;
462                }
463
464                /**
465                 * Parses a string as a URI query string.
466                 * @param query uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and
467                 * key value separator of "<code>=</code>".
468                 * @return this.
469                 */
470                public Builder fromURIQuery(String query) {
471                        function = Format.URI_QUERY.parse(query);
472                        return this;
473                }
474
475                /**
476                 * Parses a string as a URI query string. If the URI has no query portion then it
477                 * will be equivalent to empty properties.
478                 * @param uri percent encoded uri with separator as "<code>&amp;</code>" and key
479                 * value separator of "<code>=</code>".
480                 * @return this.
481                 */
482                public Builder fromURIQuery(URI uri) {
483                        String query = uri.getRawQuery();
484                        if (query == null) {
485                                query = "";
486                        }
487                        if (description == null) {
488                                description = "URI('" + uri + "')";
489                        }
490                        function = Format.URI_QUERY.parse(query);
491                        return this;
492                }
493
494                /**
495                 * Builds LogProperties based on builder config.
496                 * @return this.
497                 */
498                public LogProperties build() {
499                        if (function == null) {
500                                if (!fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
501                                        return LogProperties.of(fallbacks);
502                                }
503                                throw new IllegalStateException("function is was not set");
504                        }
505                        String description = this.description;
506                        if (description == null) {
507                                description = "custom";
508                        }
509                        var first = new DefaultLogProperties(function, description, renameKey, order);
510                        if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
511                                return first;
512                        }
513                        List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
514                        combined.add(first);
515                        combined.addAll(fallbacks);
516                        return LogProperties.of(combined);
517                }
518
519                static abstract class AbstractLogProperties implements LogProperties {
520
521                        protected final String description;
522
523                        protected final Function<String, String> renameKey;
524
525                        protected final int order;
526
527                        public AbstractLogProperties(String description, Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
528                                super();
529                                this.description = description;
530                                this.renameKey = renameKey;
531                                this.order = order;
532                        }
533
534                        @Override
535                        public int order() {
536                                return this.order;
537                        }
538
539                        @Override
540                        public String description(String key) {
541                                String rename = renameKey.apply(key);
542                                String desc = "'" + key + "' from " + description;
543                                if (!rename.equals(key)) {
544                                        desc += "[" + rename + "]";
545                                }
546                                return desc;
547                        }
548
549                        public String toString() {
550                                return getClass().getSimpleName() + "[description='" + description + "', " + "order=" + order + "]";
551                        }
552
553                }
554
555                private static final class DefaultLogProperties extends AbstractLogProperties {
556
557                        private final Function<String, @Nullable String> func;
558
559                        public DefaultLogProperties(Function<String, @Nullable String> func, String description,
560                                        Function<String, String> renameKey, int order) {
561                                super(description, renameKey, order);
562                                this.func = func;
563                        }
564
565                        @Override
566                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
567                                return func.apply(renameKey.apply(key));
568                        }
569
570                }
571
572        }
573
574        /**
575         * A log properties that can be mutated like a map.
576         */
577        public interface MutableLogProperties extends LogProperties {
578
579                /**
580                 * Assigns key to a value.
581                 * @param key key.
582                 * @param value value if null will remove the key.
583                 * @return this.
584                 */
585                MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value);
586
587                /**
588                 * Copy Java Util {@link Properties} String useful for unit testing.
589                 * @param content string in {@link Properties} format (tip use multiline strings).
590                 * @return this.
591                 */
592                default MutableLogProperties copyProperties(String content) {
593                        var m = AbstractBuilder.Format.PROPERTIES.toMap(content);
594                        for (var e : m.entrySet()) {
595                                put(e.getKey(), e.getKey());
596                        }
597                        return this;
598                }
599
600                /**
601                 * Builder for MutableLogProperties.
602                 * @return builder.
603                 */
604                public static Builder builder() {
605                        return new Builder();
606                }
607
608                /**
609                 * Mutable Log properties builer.
610                 */
611                public final class Builder extends AbstractBuilder<Builder> {
612
613                        protected Map<String, String> map = new LinkedHashMap<>();
614
615                        private Builder() {
616                        }
617
618                        @Override
619                        protected Builder self() {
620                                return this;
621                        }
622
623                        /**
624                         * Sets the backing mutable map.
625                         * @param map backing map.
626                         * @return this.
627                         */
628                        public Builder with(Map<String, String> map) {
629                                this.map = map;
630                                return this;
631                        }
632
633                        /**
634                         * Parses a string as {@link Properties} useful for unit testing with Java
635                         * multiline string literal.
636                         * @param properties properties as a string.
637                         * @return this.
638                         */
639                        public Builder copyProperties(String properties) {
640                                map.putAll(Format.PROPERTIES.toMap(properties));
641                                return this;
642                        }
643
644                        /**
645                         * Builds a mutable log properties.
646                         * @return mutable log properties.
647                         */
648                        public MutableLogProperties build() {
649                                String description = this.description;
650                                if (description == null) {
651                                        description = "custom mutable";
652                                }
653                                var first = new MapLogProperties(map, description, renameKey, order);
654                                if (fallbacks.isEmpty()) {
655                                        return first;
656                                }
657                                List<LogProperties> combined = new ArrayList<>();
658                                combined.add(first);
659                                combined.addAll(fallbacks);
660                                return new CompositeMutableLogProperties(sort(combined));
661                        }
662
663                        private static final class MapLogProperties extends LogProperties.Builder.AbstractLogProperties
664                                        implements MutableLogProperties {
665
666                                private final Map<String, String> map;
667
668                                public MapLogProperties(Map<String, String> map, String description, Function<String, String> renameKey,
669                                                int order) {
670                                        super(description, renameKey, order);
671                                        this.map = map;
672                                }
673
674                                @Override
675                                public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
676                                        return map.get(renameKey.apply(key));
677                                }
678
679                                @Override
680                                public MutableLogProperties put(String key, @Nullable String value) {
681                                        Objects.requireNonNull(key);
682                                        key = renameKey.apply(key);
683                                        if (value == null) {
684                                                map.remove(key);
685                                                return this;
686                                        }
687                                        map.put(key, value);
688                                        return this;
689                                }
690
691                        }
692
693                }
694
695        }
696
697        /**
698         * LogProperties builder.
699         * @return builder.
700         */
701        public static Builder builder() {
702                return new Builder();
703        }
704
705        /**
706         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
707         * @param logProperties list of properties.
708         * @param fallback if the logProperties list is empty.
709         * @return log properties
710         */
711        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties, LogProperties fallback) {
712                if (logProperties.isEmpty()) {
713                        return fallback;
714                }
715                if (logProperties.size() == 0) {
716                        return logProperties.get(0);
717                }
718                var array = sort(logProperties);
719                return new CompositeLogProperties(array);
720        }
721
722        private static LogProperties[] sort(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
723                var array = logProperties.stream()
724                        .filter(p -> p != StandardProperties.EMPTY)
725                        .toArray(size -> new LogProperties[size]);
726                Arrays.sort(array, Comparator.comparingInt(LogProperties::order).reversed());
727                return array;
728        }
729
730        /**
731         * Creates log properties from many log properties.
732         * @param logProperties the list of properties.
733         * @return if the logProperties is empty {@link StandardProperties#EMPTY} will be
734         * used.
735         */
736        public static LogProperties of(List<? extends LogProperties> logProperties) {
737                return of(logProperties, StandardProperties.EMPTY);
738        }
739
740        /**
741         * Creates log properties from a URI query and provided properties. This is useful for
742         * URI based providers where the URI query is contributing properties for the plugin.
743         * @param uri query will be used to pull properties from using
744         * {@link #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)}.
745         * @param prefix part of the key that will stripped before accessing the URI
746         * properties.
747         * @param properties usually this is the properties coming from {@link LogConfig}.
748         * @return combined properties where properties is tried first than the URI query
749         * parameters.
750         */
751        public static LogProperties of(URI uri, String prefix, LogProperties properties) {
752                String query = uri.getRawQuery();
753                query = query == null ? "" : query;
754                var uriProperties = LogProperties.builder()
755                        .fromURIQuery(query)
756                        .renameKey(s -> LogProperties.removeKeyPrefix(s, prefix))
757                        .build();
758                return LogProperties.of(List.of(properties, uriProperties));
759        }
760
761        /**
762         * Parse a {@linkplain URI#getRawQuery() URI query} in <a href=
763         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
764         * application/x-www-form-urlencoded </a> format useful for parsing properties values
765         * that have key values embedded in them. <strong>This parser unlike form encoding
766         * uses <code>%20</code> for space as the data is coming from a URI.</strong>
767         * @param query raw query component of URI.
768         * @param consumer accept will be called for each entry and if key (left hand) does
769         * not have a "<code>=</code>" following it the second parameter on the consumer
770         * accept will be passed <code>null</code>.
771         */
772        public static void parseUriQuery(String query,
773                        @SuppressWarnings("exports") BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
774                parseUriQuery(query, true, consumer);
775        }
776
777        /**
778         * Parses a URI query formatted string to a Map.
779         * @param query raw query component of URI.
780         * @return decoded key values with last key winning over previous equal keys.
781         * @see #parseUriQuery(String, BiConsumer)
782         */
783        public static Map<String, String> parseMap(String query) {
784                Map<String, String> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
785                parseUriQuery(query, (k, v) -> {
786                        if (v != null) {
787                                m.put(k, v);
788                        }
789                });
790                return m;
791        }
792
793        /**
794         * Parses a URI query for a multi value map. The list values of the map maybe empty if
795         * the query parameter does not have any values associated with it which would be the
796         * case if there is a parameter (key) with no "<code>=</code>" following it. For
797         * example the following would have three entries of <code>a,b,c</code> all with empty
798         * list: <pre>
799         * <code>
800         * a&amp;b&amp;c&amp;
801         * </code> </pre>
802         * @param query raw query component of URI.
803         * @return decoded key values with multiple keys grouped together in order found.
804         */
805        public static Map<String, List<String>> parseMultiMap(String query) {
806                Map<String, List<String>> m = new LinkedHashMap<>();
807                BiConsumer<String, String> f = (k, v) -> {
808                        var list = m.computeIfAbsent(k, _k -> new ArrayList<String>());
809                        if (v != null) {
810                                list.add(v);
811                        }
812                };
813                parseUriQuery(query, true, f);
814                return m;
815        }
816
817        /**
818         * Parses a list of strings from a string that is <a href=
819         * "https://www.w3.org/TR/2014/REC-html5-20141028/forms.html#url-encoded-form-data">
820         * percent encoded for escaping (application/x-www-form-urlencoded)</a> where the
821         * separator can be either "<code>&amp;</code>" or "<code>,</code>".
822         * <p>
823         * An example would be using ampersand: <pre><code>
824         *  "a&amp;b%20B&amp;c" -> ["a","b B","c"]
825         *  </code> </pre> and comma: <pre><code>
826         *  "a,b,c" -> ["a","b","c"]
827         *  </code> </pre>
828         * @param query the comma or ampersand delimited string that is in URI query format.
829         * @return list of strings
830         */
831        public static List<String> parseList(String query) {
832                List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();
833                parseUriQuery(query, true, "[&,]", (k, v) -> list.add(k));
834                return list;
835        }
836
837        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
838                parseUriQuery(query, decode, "&", consumer);
839        }
840
841        private static void parseUriQuery(String query, boolean decode, String sep,
842                        BiConsumer<String, @Nullable String> consumer) {
843                String[] pairs = query.split(sep);
844                for (String pair : pairs) {
845                        int idx = pair.indexOf("=");
846                        String key;
847                        String value;
848                        if (idx == 0) {
849                                continue;
850                        }
851                        else if (idx < 0) {
852                                key = pair;
853                                value = null;
854                        }
855                        else {
856                                key = pair.substring(0, idx);
857                                value = pair.substring(idx + 1);
858                        }
859                        if (decode) {
860                                key = PercentCodec.decode(key, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
861                                if (value != null) {
862                                        value = PercentCodec.decode(value, StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
863                                }
864
865                        }
866                        if (key.isBlank()) {
867                                continue;
868                        }
869                        consumer.accept(key, value);
870                }
871        }
872
873        /**
874         * Common static log properties such as System properties ane environment variables.
875         */
876        enum StandardProperties implements LogProperties {
877
878                /**
879                 * Empty properties. The order is <code>-1</code>.
880                 */
881                EMPTY {
882                        @Override
883                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
884                                return null;
885                        }
886
887                        @Override
888                        public int order() {
889                                return -1;
890                        }
891                },
892                /**
893                 * Uses {@link System#getProperty(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}. The
894                 * {@link #order()} is <code>400</code> which the same value as microprofile
895                 * config ordinal.
896                 */
897                SYSTEM_PROPERTIES {
898                        @Override
899                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
900                                return System.getProperty(key);
901                        }
902
903                        @Override
904                        public int order() {
905                                return 400;
906                        }
907                },
908                /**
909                 * Uses {@link System#getenv(String)} for {@link #valueOrNull(String)}.The
910                 * {@link #order()} is <code>300</code> which is the same value as microprofile
911                 * config ordinal.
912                 */
913                ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLES {
914                        @Override
915                        public @Nullable String valueOrNull(String key) {
916                                return System.getenv(translateKey(key));
917                        }
918
919                        @Override
920                        protected String translateKey(String key) {
921                                return key.replace(".", "_");
922                        }
923
924                };
925
926                @Override
927                public String description(String key) {
928                        String k = translateKey(key);
929                        String description = "'" + key + "' from " + name();
930                        if (!k.equals(key)) {
931                                description += "[" + k + "]";
932                        }
933                        return description;
934                }
935
936                protected String translateKey(String key) {
937                        return key;
938                }
939
940        }
941
942        /**
943         * An error friendly {@link Function} for converting properties.
944         *
945         * @param <T> input type.
946         * @param <R> output type.
947         * @param <E> error type.
948         */
949        public interface PropertyFunction<T extends @Nullable Object, R extends @Nullable Object, E extends Exception>
950                        extends Function<T, R> {
951
952                @Override
953                default R apply(T t) {
954                        try {
955                                return _apply(t);
956                        }
957                        catch (Exception e) {
958                                sneakyThrow(e);
959                                throw new RuntimeException(e);
960                        }
961                }
962
963                /**
964                 * Apply that throws error.
965                 * @param t input
966                 * @return output
967                 * @throws E if an error happened in function.
968                 */
969                public R _apply(T t) throws E;
970
971                @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
972                private static <E extends Throwable> void sneakyThrow(final Throwable x) throws E {
973                        throw (E) x;
974                }
975
976        }
977
978        /**
979         * Parent interface for property exceptions.
980         */
981        sealed interface PropertyProblem {
982
983        }
984
985        /**
986         * Thrown if an error happens while converting a property.
987         */
988        final static class PropertyConvertException extends RuntimeException implements PropertyProblem {
989
990                private static final long serialVersionUID = -6260241455268426342L;
991
992                /**
993                 * Key.
994                 */
995                private final String key;
996
997                /**
998                 * Creates convert exception.
999                 * @param key property key.
1000                 * @param message error message
1001                 * @param cause maybe null.
1002                 */
1003                PropertyConvertException(String key, String message, @Nullable Throwable cause) {
1004                        super(message, cause);
1005                        this.key = key;
1006                }
1007
1008                /**
1009                 * Property key.
1010                 * @return key.
1011                 */
1012                public String key() {
1013                        return this.key;
1014                }
1015
1016        }
1017
1018        /**
1019         * Throw if property is missing.
1020         */
1021        final static class PropertyMissingException extends NoSuchElementException implements PropertyProblem {
1022
1023                private static final long serialVersionUID = 4203076848052565692L;
1024
1025                /**
1026                 * Creates a missing propety exception.
1027                 * @param s error message.
1028                 */
1029                PropertyMissingException(String s) {
1030                        super(s);
1031                }
1032
1033        }
1034
1035        /**
1036         * Searches a {@value LogProperties#SEP} separated property path recursing up the path
1037         * till a non null value (not missing) is found.
1038         * <p>
1039         * For example assume we have a single property set like
1040         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff=DEBUG</code> and we call this function with
1041         * <code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code>.
1042         * <ol>
1043         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a.b</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1044         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff.a</code> will resolve to <code>null</code></li>
1045         * <li><code>logging.level.com.stuff</code> will resolve to <code>"DEBUG"</code>, stop
1046         * and return <code>"DEBUG"</code>.</li>
1047         * </ol>
1048         * @param <T> type to return.
1049         * @param key the initial path.
1050         * @param resolveFunc function that returns the value at path or <code>null</code>.
1051         * @return value or <code>null</code>.
1052         */
1053        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
1054        public static <T> @Nullable T searchPath(String key, Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc) {
1055                return searchPath(key, resolveFunc, SEP);
1056        }
1057
1058        private static <T> @Nullable T searchPath(String key, Function<String, @Nullable T> resolveFunc, String sep) {
1059                String tempName = key;
1060                T level = null;
1061                int indexOfLastDot = tempName.length();
1062                while ((level == null) && (indexOfLastDot > -1)) {
1063                        tempName = tempName.substring(0, indexOfLastDot);
1064                        level = resolveFunc.apply(tempName);
1065                        indexOfLastDot = tempName.lastIndexOf(sep);
1066                }
1067                if (level != null) {
1068                        return level;
1069                }
1070                return resolveFunc.apply("");
1071        }
1072
1073        /**
1074         * Concats a key using {@link #SEP} to the root prefix.
1075         * @param name key.
1076         * @return concat key.
1077         */
1078        static String concatKey(String name) {
1079                return concatKey(LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX, name);
1080        }
1081
1082        /**
1083         * Concats a keys using {@link #SEP} as the separator.
1084         * @param prefix start of key.
1085         * @param name second part of key.
1086         * @return key.
1087         */
1088        static String concatKey(String prefix, String name) {
1089                if (name.equals("")) {
1090                        return prefix;
1091                }
1092                if (prefix.equals("")) {
1093                        return name;
1094                }
1095                if (prefix.endsWith(".")) {
1096                        prefix = prefix.substring(0, prefix.length() - 1);
1097                }
1098                if (name.startsWith(SEP)) {
1099                        return prefix + name;
1100                }
1101                return prefix + SEP + name;
1102        }
1103
1104        /**
1105         * Replace "{name}" tokens in property names.
1106         * @param key property name.
1107         * @param parameters tokens to replace with entry values.
1108         * @return interpolated property key.
1109         */
1110        static String interpolateKey(String key, Map<String, String> parameters) {
1111                for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : parameters.entrySet()) {
1112                        key = key.replace("{" + entry.getKey() + "}", entry.getValue());
1113                }
1114                return key;
1115        }
1116
1117        /**
1118         * Interpolates a named key which is a property key that has a {@value #NAME}.
1119         * @param key with name parameters.
1120         * @param name replace name token.
1121         * @return interpolated property key.
1122         */
1123        static String interpolateNamedKey(String key, String name) {
1124                return interpolateKey(key, Map.of(NAME, name));
1125        }
1126
1127        /**
1128         * Remove key prefix from the key. Prefix should end in "." but this method does not
1129         * check that.
1130         * @param key key whose prefix will be removed.
1131         * @param prefix property name prefix.
1132         * @return prefix removed if the string is prefixed.
1133         */
1134        static String removeKeyPrefix(String key, String prefix) {
1135                if (key.startsWith(prefix)) {
1136                        return key.substring(prefix.length());
1137                }
1138                return key;
1139        }
1140
1141        /**
1142         * Property prefix parameter pattern.
1143         */
1144        static final Pattern PARAMETER_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("\\{(.*?)\\}");
1145
1146        /**
1147         * Extract key parameters with {@link #PARAMETER_PATTERN}.
1148         * @param key also known as property name.
1149         * @return parameters in key.
1150         */
1151        static Set<String> keyParameters(String key) {
1152                Set<String> tokens = new LinkedHashSet<>();
1153                Matcher matcher = PARAMETER_PATTERN.matcher(key);
1154                while (matcher.find()) {
1155                        tokens.add(matcher.group(1));
1156                }
1157                return tokens;
1158        }
1159
1160        private static void validateKeyParameters(String key, Set<String> parameters) {
1161                var keyParameters = keyParameters(key);
1162                if (!parameters.equals(keyParameters)) {
1163                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Keyed parameter mismatch. key is parameters: " + keyParameters
1164                                        + " provided parameters: " + parameters);
1165                }
1166        }
1167
1168        /**
1169         * The result of a property fetched from properties.
1170         *
1171         * @param <T> property type.
1172         */
1173        sealed interface Result<T> {
1174
1175                /**
1176                 * Gets the value.
1177                 * @return value or <code>null</code>.
1178                 */
1179                public @Nullable T valueOrNull();
1180
1181                /**
1182                 * Gets a value if there is if not uses the fallback.
1183                 * @param fallback maybe <code>null</code>.
1184                 * @return value.
1185                 */
1186                default @Nullable T valueOrNull(@Nullable T fallback) {
1187                        var v = valueOrNull();
1188                        if (v != null) {
1189                                return v;
1190                        }
1191                        return fallback;
1192                }
1193
1194                /**
1195                 * Gets the value and will fail with {@link NoSuchElementException} if there is no
1196                 * value.
1197                 * @return value.
1198                 * @throws PropertyMissingException if there is no value.
1199                 * @throws PropertyConvertException if the property failed conversion.
1200                 */
1201                public T value() throws PropertyMissingException, PropertyConvertException;
1202
1203                /**
1204                 * Gets a value if there if not uses the fallback if not null otherwise throws an
1205                 * exception.
1206                 * @param fallback maybe <code>null</code>.
1207                 * @return value.
1208                 * @throws PropertyMissingException if no property and fallback is
1209                 * <code>null</code>.
1210                 * @throws PropertyConvertException if the property failed conversion.
1211                 */
1212                default T value(@Nullable T fallback) throws PropertyMissingException, PropertyConvertException {
1213                        if (fallback == null) {
1214                                return value();
1215                        }
1216                        return value(() -> fallback);
1217                }
1218
1219                /**
1220                 * Gets a value if there if not uses the fallback if not null otherwise throws an
1221                 * exception.
1222                 * @param fallback maybe <code>null</code>.
1223                 * @return value.
1224                 * @throws PropertyMissingException if no property and fallback is
1225                 * <code>null</code>.
1226                 * @throws PropertyConvertException if the property failed conversion.
1227                 */
1228                public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1229                                throws PropertyMissingException, PropertyConvertException;
1230
1231                /**
1232                 * Convenience that turns a value into an optional.
1233                 * @return optional.
1234                 */
1235                default Optional<T> optional() {
1236                        return Optional.ofNullable(valueOrNull());
1237                }
1238
1239                /**
1240                 * A property that is present.
1241                 *
1242                 * @param <T> property type.
1243                 * @param value actual value.
1244                 */
1245                public record Success<T>(T value) implements RequiredResult<T> {
1246                        /**
1247                         * Succesfully found property value.
1248                         * @param value actual value should not be <code>null</code>.
1249                         */
1250                        public Success {
1251                                value = Objects.requireNonNull(value);
1252                        }
1253
1254                        @Override
1255                        public @Nullable T valueOrNull() {
1256                                return value();
1257                        }
1258
1259                        @Override
1260                        public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1261                                        throws NoSuchElementException {
1262                                return value;
1263                        }
1264                }
1265
1266                /**
1267                 * A property that is missing (<code>null</code>).
1268                 *
1269                 * @param <T> property type.
1270                 * @param message description of where the property is missing.
1271                 */
1272                public record Missing<T>(String message) implements Result<T> {
1273                        @Override
1274                        public @Nullable T valueOrNull() {
1275                                return null;
1276                        }
1277
1278                        @Override
1279                        public T value() throws NoSuchElementException {
1280                                throw new PropertyMissingException(message);
1281                        }
1282
1283                        @Override
1284                        public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1285                                        throws NoSuchElementException {
1286                                var v = fallback.get();
1287                                if (v != null) {
1288                                        return v;
1289                                }
1290                                throw new PropertyMissingException(message);
1291                        }
1292
1293                        /**
1294                         * Helper just to cast the result to a different parameterized type.
1295                         * @param <R> paramterized type.
1296                         * @return this.
1297                         */
1298                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1299                        public <R> Missing<R> convert() {
1300                                return (Missing<R>) this;
1301                        }
1302
1303                }
1304
1305                /**
1306                 * A property that was present but failed conversion.
1307                 *
1308                 * @param <T> property type.
1309                 * @param key property key that failed to convert.
1310                 * @param message failure message.
1311                 * @param cause exception thrown while trying to convert.
1312                 */
1313                public record Error<T>(String key, String message, Exception cause) implements RequiredResult<T> {
1314
1315                        @Override
1316                        public @Nullable T valueOrNull() {
1317                                throw new PropertyConvertException(key, message, cause);
1318                        }
1319
1320                        @Override
1321                        public T value() throws NoSuchElementException {
1322                                throw new PropertyConvertException(key, message, cause);
1323                        }
1324
1325                        @Override
1326                        public T value(@SuppressWarnings("exports") Supplier<? extends @Nullable T> fallback)
1327                                        throws NoSuchElementException {
1328                                throw new PropertyConvertException(key, message, cause);
1329                        }
1330
1331                        /**
1332                         * Helper just to cast the result to a different parameterized type.
1333                         * @param <R> paramterized type.
1334                         * @return this.
1335                         */
1336                        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1337                        public <R> Error<R> convert() {
1338                                return (Error<R>) this;
1339                        }
1340                }
1341
1342        }
1343
1344        /**
1345         * A result that is not missing and will either be an error or success.
1346         *
1347         * @param <T> property type.
1348         */
1349        sealed interface RequiredResult<T> extends Result<T> {
1350
1351        }
1352
1353        /**
1354         * A property description that can retrieve a property result by being passed
1355         * {@link LogProperties}. <em>The property instance does not actually contain the
1356         * value of the property!</em>.
1357         *
1358         * @param <T> property type.
1359         * @see RequiredProperty
1360         * @see Result
1361         */
1362        sealed interface Property<T> {
1363
1364                /**
1365                 * Gets the first key.
1366                 * @return key.
1367                 */
1368                public String key();
1369
1370                /**
1371                 * Gets a property value as a result.
1372                 * @param properties key values.
1373                 * @return result.
1374                 */
1375                public Result<T> get(LogProperties properties);
1376
1377                /**
1378                 * Maps the property to another value type.
1379                 * @param <U> value type.
1380                 * @param mapper function to map.
1381                 * @return property.
1382                 */
1383                public <U> Property<U> map(PropertyFunction<? super T, ? extends U, ? super Exception> mapper);
1384
1385                /**
1386                 * Converts the value into a String that can be parsed by the builtin properties
1387                 * parsing of types. Supported types: String, Boolean, Integer, URI, Map, List.
1388                 * @param value to be converted to string.
1389                 * @return property representation of value.
1390                 */
1391                public String propertyString(T value);
1392
1393                /**
1394                 * Set a property if its not null.
1395                 * @param value value to set.
1396                 * @param consumer first parameter is first key and second parameter is non null
1397                 * value.
1398                 */
1399                public void set(T value, BiConsumer<String, T> consumer);
1400
1401                /**
1402                 * Builder.
1403                 * @return builder.
1404                 */
1405                public static RootPropertyGetter builder() {
1406                        return PropertyGetter.of();
1407                }
1408
1409        }
1410
1411        /**
1412         * A property that should never be missing usually because there is non-null fallback.
1413         *
1414         * @param <T> property type.
1415         */
1416        sealed interface RequiredProperty<T> extends Property<T> {
1417
1418                /**
1419                 * Gets a property value as a result.
1420                 * @param properties key values.
1421                 * @return result.
1422                 */
1423                public RequiredResult<T> get(LogProperties properties);
1424
1425                /**
1426                 * Maps the property to another value type.
1427                 * @param <U> value type.
1428                 * @param mapper function to map.
1429                 * @return property.
1430                 */
1431                public <U> RequiredProperty<U> map(PropertyFunction<? super T, ? extends U, ? super Exception> mapper);
1432
1433        }
1434
1435        /**
1436         * Extracts and converts from {@link LogProperties} and is also an immutable builder
1437         * for {@link Property}s.
1438         *
1439         * @param <T> value type.
1440         */
1441        sealed interface PropertyGetter<T> {
1442
1443                /**
1444                 * Gets a result from properties.
1445                 * @param props properties.
1446                 * @param key property key usually dotted.
1447                 * @return result.
1448                 */
1449                Result<T> get(LogProperties props, String key);
1450
1451                /**
1452                 * Gets a result from properties by trying a list of keys.
1453                 * @param props properties.
1454                 * @param keys list of property keys usually dotted.
1455                 * @return result.
1456                 */
1457                default Result<T> get(LogProperties props, List<String> keys) {
1458                        for (String key : keys) {
1459                                var r = get(props, key);
1460                                @Nullable
1461                                Result<T> found = switch (r) {
1462                                        case Result.Success<T> s -> s;
1463                                        case Result.Error<T> s -> s;
1464                                        case Result.Missing<T> s -> null;
1465                                };
1466                                if (found != null) {
1467                                        return found;
1468                                }
1469                        }
1470                        return findRoot(this).missingResult(props, keys);
1471                }
1472
1473                /**
1474                 * Converts the value into a String that can be parsed by the builtin properties
1475                 * parsing of types. Supported types: String, Boolean, Integer, URI, Map, List.
1476                 * @param value to be converted to string.
1477                 * @return property representation of value.
1478                 */
1479                String propertyString(T value);
1480
1481                /**
1482                 * Determines full name of key.
1483                 * @param key key.
1484                 * @return fully qualified key name.
1485                 */
1486                default String fullyQualifiedKey(String key) {
1487                        return findRoot(this).fullyQualifiedKey(key);
1488                }
1489
1490                /**
1491                 * Validates the key is correctly prefixed.
1492                 * @param key dotted key.
1493                 */
1494                default void validateKey(String key) {
1495                        String fqn = fullyQualifiedKey(key);
1496                        if (!fqn.startsWith(LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX)) {
1497                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1498                                                "Property key should start with: '" + LogProperties.ROOT_PREFIX + "'. key = " + key);
1499                        }
1500                        if (fqn.endsWith(".") || fqn.startsWith(".")) {
1501                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1502                                                "Property key should not start or end with '" + LogProperties.SEP + "'");
1503                        }
1504                        validateKeyParameters(key, Set.of());
1505                }
1506
1507                /**
1508                 * Creates a Property from the given key and this getter.
1509                 * @param key key.
1510                 * @return property.
1511                 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the key is malformed.
1512                 */
1513                default Property<T> build(String key) throws IllegalArgumentException {
1514                        validateKey(key);
1515                        return new DefaultProperty<>(this, List.of(key));
1516                }
1517
1518                /**
1519                 * Creates a Property from the given key and its {@value LogProperties#NAME}
1520                 * parameter.
1521                 * @param key key.
1522                 * @param name interpolates <code>{name}</code> in property name with this value.
1523                 * @return property.
1524                 */
1525                default Property<T> buildWithName(String key, String name) {
1526                        var parameters = Map.of(NAME, name);
1527                        validateKeyParameters(key, parameters.keySet());
1528                        String fqn = LogProperties.interpolateKey(key, parameters);
1529                        return build(fqn);
1530                }
1531
1532                /**
1533                 * Find root property getter.
1534                 * @param e property getter.
1535                 * @return root.
1536                 */
1537                public static RootPropertyGetter findRoot(PropertyGetter<?> e) {
1538                        return switch (e) {
1539                                case RootPropertyGetter r -> r;
1540                                case ChildPropertyGetter<?> c -> findRoot(c.parent());
1541                        };
1542                }
1543
1544                /**
1545                 * Default root property getter.
1546                 * @return property getter.
1547                 */
1548                public static RootPropertyGetter of() {
1549                        return new RootPropertyGetter("", false);
1550                }
1551
1552                /**
1553                 * A property getter and <strong>builder</strong> that has no conversion but may
1554                 * prefix the key and search recursively up the key path.
1555                 * <p>
1556                 * While you can map the string properties with {@link #map(PropertyFunction)} it
1557                 * is preferred to use the <code>to</code> methods on this class for basic types
1558                 * especially for list or map types as the implementation will call the
1559                 * implementation specific in LogProperties. An example is {@link #toMap()} which
1560                 * will call the LogProperties implementration of
1561                 * {@link LogProperties#mapOrNull(String)}.
1562                 *
1563                 * @param prefix added to the key before looking up in {@link LogProperties}.
1564                 * @param search if true will recursively search up the key path
1565                 */
1566                record RootPropertyGetter(String prefix, boolean search) implements PropertyGetter<String> {
1567
1568                        // @Override
1569                        private @Nullable String valueOrNull(LogProperties props, String key) {
1570                                if (search) {
1571                                        return props.search(prefix, key);
1572                                }
1573                                return props.valueOrNull(fullyQualifiedKey(key));
1574                        }
1575
1576                        @Override
1577                        public Result<String> get(LogProperties props, String key) {
1578                                var v = valueOrNull(props, key);
1579                                if (v == null) {
1580                                        return missingResult(props, List.of(key));
1581                                }
1582                                return new Result.Success<>(v);
1583                        }
1584
1585                        @Override
1586                        public String propertyString(String value) {
1587                                return value;
1588                        }
1589
1590                        <T> Result.Error<T> errorResult(LogProperties props, String key, Exception e) {
1591                                String resolvedKey = props.description(fullyQualifiedKey(key));
1592                                String message = "Error for property. key: '" + resolvedKey + "', " + e.getMessage();
1593                                return new Result.Error<>(resolvedKey, message, e);
1594                        }
1595
1596                        <T> Result.Missing<T> missingResult(LogProperties props, List<String> keys) {
1597                                List<String> resolvedKeys = describeKeys(props, keys);
1598                                String message = "Property missing. keys: " + resolvedKeys;
1599                                return new Result.Missing<>(message);
1600                        }
1601
1602                        List<String> describeKeys(LogProperties props, List<String> keys) {
1603                                return keys.stream().map(k -> props.description(fullyQualifiedKey(k))).toList();
1604                        }
1605
1606                        /**
1607                         * Will search with prefix.
1608                         * @param prefix prefix.
1609                         * @return new property getter.
1610                         */
1611                        public RootPropertyGetter withSearch(String prefix) {
1612                                return new RootPropertyGetter(prefix, true);
1613                        }
1614
1615                        /**
1616                         * Will prefix key.
1617                         * @param prefix prefix.
1618                         * @return new property getter.
1619                         */
1620                        public RootPropertyGetter withPrefix(String prefix) {
1621                                return new RootPropertyGetter(prefix, search);
1622                        }
1623
1624                        @Override
1625                        public String fullyQualifiedKey(String key) {
1626                                return concatKey(prefix, key);
1627                        }
1628
1629                        /**
1630                         * An integer property getter.
1631                         * @return getter that will convert to integers.
1632                         */
1633                        public PropertyGetter<Integer> toInt() {
1634                                return new FuncGetter<>(this, Integer::parseInt, String::valueOf);
1635                        }
1636
1637                        /**
1638                         * A boolean property getter.
1639                         * @return getter that will convert to boolean.
1640                         */
1641                        public PropertyGetter<Boolean> toBoolean() {
1642                                return new FuncGetter<>(this, Boolean::parseBoolean, String::valueOf);
1643                        }
1644
1645                        /**
1646                         * A Map property that will use {@link LogProperties#mapOrNull(String)}.
1647                         * @return getter that will convert string property to a Map.
1648                         */
1649                        public PropertyGetter<Map<String, String>> toMap() {
1650                                return new MapGetter(this);
1651                        }
1652
1653                        /**
1654                         * A list property that will use {@link LogProperties#listOrNull(String)}.
1655                         * @return getter that will convert string property to a List.
1656                         */
1657                        public PropertyGetter<List<String>> toList() {
1658                                return new ListGetter(this);
1659                        }
1660
1661                        /**
1662                         * An enum property getter using {@link Enum#valueOf(Class, String)}.
1663                         * @param <T> enum type.
1664                         * @param enumClass enum class.
1665                         * @return getter that will convert to enum type.
1666                         */
1667                        public <T extends Enum<T>> PropertyGetter<T> toEnum(Class<T> enumClass) {
1668                                return new FuncGetter<>(this, s -> Enum.valueOf(enumClass, s), String::valueOf);
1669                        }
1670
1671                        /**
1672                         * A URI property getter that parses URIs.
1673                         * @return getter that will parse URIs.
1674                         */
1675                        public PropertyGetter<URI> toURI() {
1676                                return new FuncGetter<>(this, URI::new, String::valueOf);
1677                        }
1678
1679                }
1680
1681                /**
1682                 * Mapped property getter.
1683                 *
1684                 * @param <T> will convert to this type.
1685                 */
1686                public sealed interface ChildPropertyGetter<T> extends PropertyGetter<T> {
1687
1688                        /**
1689                         * Parent.
1690                         * @return parent.
1691                         */
1692                        PropertyGetter<?> parent();
1693
1694                        @Override
1695                        default String propertyString(T value) {
1696                                return switch (value) {
1697                                        case String s -> s;
1698                                        case Boolean b -> String.valueOf(b);
1699                                        case Integer i -> String.valueOf(i);
1700                                        case URI u -> String.valueOf(u);
1701                                        case Map<?, ?> m -> MapGetter._propertyString(m);
1702                                        case List<?> list -> ListGetter._propertyString(list);
1703                                        default -> throw new RuntimeException("Unable to convert to property string. value = " + value);
1704                                };
1705                        }
1706
1707                }
1708
1709                /**
1710                 * Sets up to converts a value.
1711                 * @param <U> value type
1712                 * @param mapper function.
1713                 * @return new property getter.
1714                 */
1715                default <U> PropertyGetter<U> map(PropertyFunction<? super T, ? extends U, ? super Exception> mapper) {
1716                        return new FuncGetter<T, U>(this, mapper, null);
1717                }
1718
1719                /**
1720                 * Fallback to value if property not found.
1721                 * @param fallback fallback value.
1722                 * @return new property getter.
1723                 */
1724                default RequiredPropertyGetter<T> orElse(T fallback) {
1725                        Objects.requireNonNull(fallback);
1726                        return new FallbackGetter<T>(this, () -> fallback);
1727                }
1728
1729                /**
1730                 * Fallback to value if property not found.
1731                 * @param fallback supplier.
1732                 * @return new property getter.
1733                 */
1734                default RequiredPropertyGetter<T> orElseGet(Supplier<? extends T> fallback) {
1735                        Objects.requireNonNull(fallback);
1736                        return new FallbackGetter<T>(this, fallback);
1737                }
1738
1739                /**
1740                 * A property getter that guarantees the result will not be missing usually
1741                 * because a non-null fallback is provided somewhere.
1742                 *
1743                 * @param <T> property type.
1744                 */
1745                public sealed interface RequiredPropertyGetter<T> extends ChildPropertyGetter<T> {
1746
1747                        /**
1748                         * This call unlike the parent returns a required result. {@inheritDoc}
1749                         */
1750                        RequiredResult<T> get(LogProperties props, String key);
1751
1752                        /**
1753                         * Gets a result from properties by trying a list of keys.
1754                         * @param props properties.
1755                         * @param keys list of property keys usually dotted.
1756                         * @return result.
1757                         */
1758                        default RequiredResult<T> get(LogProperties props, List<String> keys) {
1759                                if (keys.isEmpty()) {
1760                                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Keys is empty");
1761                                }
1762                                String key = keys.getFirst();
1763                                return get(props, key);
1764                        }
1765
1766                        /**
1767                         * Sets up to converts a value.
1768                         * @param <U> value type
1769                         * @param mapper function.
1770                         * @return new property getter.
1771                         */
